00010 void Mesh::loadObj(std::string filename)
00011 {
00012     std::fstream instream;
00013     instream.open(filename.c_str());
00014     //printf("Mesh::Loading mesh from %s\n", filename.c_str());
00015     if (!instream.is_open())
00016     {
00017         printf("Mesh::Error opening file");
00018         return;
00019     }
00020     while (!instream.eof())
00021     {
00022         std::string currentLine;
00023         getline(instream, currentLine);
00024         //printf("Mesh::Currentline is %s\n", currentLine.c_str());
00025         if (currentLine != "")  //Make sure that there is a first character to avoid errors
00026         {
00027             int temp;   //Used for throwing away dumps in sscanf
00028             if (sscanf(currentLine.c_str(), "v %f%*s", &temp) == 1) {   //This is a vertex
00029                 vertices.push_back(Point3(currentLine));
00030             } else if (sscanf(currentLine.c_str(), "vt %f%*s", &temp) == 1) {   //This is a texture vertex
00031                 //This is where I would do something with the texture guys
00032             } else if (sscanf(currentLine.c_str(), "vn %f%*s", &temp) == 1) {   //This is a normal
00033                 //printf("Loading a normal\n");
00034                 normals.push_back(Point3(currentLine));
00035             } else if (sscanf(currentLine.c_str(), "f %*s") == 0) {  //This is a face
00036                 if (sscanf(currentLine.c_str(), "f %i/%i/%i%*s", &temp, &temp, &temp) == 3) {   //Vertex, textures, and normals
00037                     std::vector<int> faceVerts;  //
00038                     std::vector<int> faceTexts;
00039                     std::vector<int> faceNorms;
00040                     std::string facePiece = "";
00041                     std::stringstream curLineStream(currentLine);
00042                     getline(curLineStream, facePiece, ' '); //Get the piece that is just 'f'
00043                     while(!curLineStream.eof())
00044                     {
00045                         getline(curLineStream, facePiece, ' ');
00046                         int vertIndex, textIndex, normIndex;
00047                         if (sscanf(facePiece.c_str(), "%i/%i/%i", &vertIndex, &textIndex, &normIndex) != 3) {
00048                             //Throw an error here
00049                         } else {
00050                             vertIndex -= 1; //Subtract one, since .obj files begin indexing at 1 instead of 0
00051                             textIndex -= 1;
00052                             normIndex -= 1;
00053                             if (vertIndex < 0 || vertIndex >= vertices.size()) {
00054                                 //Throw an error here
00055                             } else {
00056                                 faceVerts.push_back(vertIndex);
00057                             }
00058                             if (textIndex < 0 || textIndex >= textures.size()) {
00059                                 //Throw an error here
00060                             } else {
00061                                 faceTexts.push_back(textIndex);
00062                             }
00063                             if (normIndex < 0 || normIndex >= normals.size()) {
00064                                 //Throw an error here
00065                             } else {
00066                                 faceNorms.push_back(normIndex);
00067                             }
00068                         }
00069                     }
00070                     addFace(faceVerts, faceNorms);
00071                 } else if (sscanf(currentLine.c_str(), "f %i//%i%*s", &temp, &temp) == 2) { //Vertex, normals
00072                     std::vector<int> faceVerts;  //
00073                     std::vector<int> faceNorms;
00074                     std::string facePiece = "";
00075                     std::stringstream curLineStream(currentLine);
00076                     getline(curLineStream, facePiece, ' '); //Get the piece that is just 'f'
00077                     while(!curLineStream.eof())
00078                     {
00079                         getline(curLineStream, facePiece, ' ');
00080                         int vertIndex, normIndex;
00081                         if (sscanf(facePiece.c_str(), "%i//%i", &vertIndex, &normIndex) != 2) {
00082                             //Throw an error here
00083                         } else {
00084                             vertIndex -= 1; //Subtract one, since .obj files begin indexing at 1 instead of 0
00085                             normIndex -= 1;
00086                             if (vertIndex < 0 || vertIndex >= vertices.size()) {
00087                                 //Throw and error here
00088                             } else {
00089                                 faceVerts.push_back(vertIndex);
00090                             }
00091                             if (normIndex < 0 || normIndex >= normals.size()) {
00092                                 //Throw an error here
00093                             } else {
00094                                 faceNorms.push_back(normIndex);
00095                             }
00096                         }
00097                     }
00098                     addFace(faceVerts, faceNorms);
00099                 } else if (sscanf(currentLine.c_str(), "f %i/%i%*s", &temp, &temp) == 2) {  //Vertex, textures
00100                     std::vector<int> faceVerts;  //
00101                     std::vector<int> faceTexts;
00102                     std::string facePiece = "";
00103                     std::stringstream curLineStream(currentLine);
00104                     getline(curLineStream, facePiece, ' '); //Get the piece that is just 'f'
00105                     while(!curLineStream.eof())
00106                     {
00107                         getline(curLineStream, facePiece, ' ');
00108                         int vertIndex, textIndex;
00109                         if (sscanf(facePiece.c_str(), "%i/%i", &vertIndex, &textIndex) != 2) {
00110                             //Throw an error here
00111                         } else {
00112                             vertIndex -= 1; //Subtract one, since .obj files begin indexing at 1 instead of 0
00113                             textIndex -= 1;
00114                             if (vertIndex < 0 || vertIndex >= vertices.size()) {
00115                                 //Throw and error here
00116                             } else {
00117                                 faceVerts.push_back(vertIndex);
00118                             }
00119                             if (textIndex < 0 || textIndex >= textures.size()) {
00120                                 //Throw an error here
00121                             } else {
00122                                 faceTexts.push_back(textIndex);
00123                             }
00124                         }
00125                     }
00126                     addFace(faceVerts);
00127                 } else if (sscanf(currentLine.c_str(), "f %i%*s", &temp) == 1) { //Just vertex
00128                     //printf("Mesh::Pushing back a face\n");
00129                     std::vector<int> faceVerts;
00130                     std::string facePiece = "";
00131                     std::stringstream curLineStream(currentLine);
00132                     getline(curLineStream, facePiece, ' '); //Get the piece that is just 'f'
00133                     while(!curLineStream.eof())
00134                     {
00135                         getline(curLineStream, facePiece, ' ');
00136                         //printf("Mesh::facePiece is %s, ", facePiece.c_str());
00137                         //For now, just get the vertex, ignore the other stuff
00138                         int vertIndex;
00139                         if (sscanf(facePiece.c_str(), "%i%*s", &vertIndex) == 1) {    //If it finds it
00140                             vertIndex -= 1;     //For whatever reason, in .obj files, each list starts with index 1
00141                             //printf("vertIndex is %i\n", vertIndex);
00142                             if (vertIndex >= 0 && vertIndex < vertices.size()) {      //If the index is in a valid range
00143                                 faceVerts.push_back(vertIndex);
00144                             } else {
00145                                 printf("Error: vertIndex in MeshObjLoader was out of range\n");
00146                             }
00147                         } else {
00148                             printf("Error: MeshObjLoader: %s is not the proper format for a face piece\n", facePiece.c_str());
00149                         }
00150                     }
00151                     addFace(faceVerts);
00152                 }
00153             } else {
00154                 printf("Got something in the Obj file that wasn't what I expected: %s\n", currentLine.c_str());
00155             }
00156         }
00157     }
00158 
00159     /* For printing out a mesh after loading * /
00160     printf("Loaded a mesh, vertices are:\n");
00161     for (int i = 0; i < vertices.size(); i++) {
00162         printf("   %i: <%f, %f, %f>\n", i, vertices[i].x, vertices[i].y, vertices[i].z);
00163     }
00164     printf("Loaded a mesh, textures are:\n");
00165     for (int i = 0; i < textures.size(); i++) {
00166         printf("   %i: <%f, %f, %f>\n", i, textures[i].x, textures[i].y, textures[i].z);
00167     }
00168     printf("Loaded a mesh, normals are:\n");
00169     for (int i = 0; i < normals.size(); i++) {
00170         printf("   %i: <%f, %f, %f>\n", i, normals[i].x, normals[i].y, normals[i].z);
00171     }
00172     /**/
00173 
00174     instream.close();
00175 }

00177 void Mesh::addFace(std::vector<int>& vertIndexes, std::vector<int>& normalIndexes) {
00178     Face newFace;
00179     newFace.registerVertices(&(this->vertices));
00180     newFace.registerVertexIndexes(vertIndexes);
00181     newFace.registerNormals(&(this->normals));
00182     newFace.registerNormalIndexes(normalIndexes);
00183     faces.push_back(newFace);
00184     /*
00185     printf("Created a face: ");
00186     for (int i = 0; i < vertIndexes.size(); i++) {
00187         printf("%i/%i ", vertIndexes[i], normalIndexes[i]);
00188     }
00189     printf("\n");
00190     */
00191 }
00192 
00193 void Mesh::addFace(std::vector<int>& vertIndexes) {
00194     Face newFace;
00195     newFace.registerVertices(&(this->vertices));
00196     newFace.registerVertexIndexes(vertIndexes);
00197 
00198     //Register the normals anyway, even though they aren't being used
00199     newFace.registerNormals(&(this->normals));
00200     faces.push_back(newFace);
00201 }
00202 
00203 //Adds two faces, facing in both directions, so that one can be sure that neither side is see through
00204 void Mesh::addFaceAndReverse(std::vector<int>& vertIndexes, std::vector<int>& normalIndexes) {
00205     addFace(vertIndexes, normalIndexes);
00206     std::vector<int> newVerts;
00207     std::vector<int> newNorms;
00208     newVerts.resize(vertIndexes.size());
00209     newNorms.resize(normalIndexes.size());
00210     for (int i = 0; i < vertIndexes.size(); i++) {
00211         newVerts[i] = vertIndexes[vertIndexes.size() - i - 1];
00212     }
00213     for (int i = 0; i < normalIndexes.size(); i++) {
00214         newNorms[i] = normalIndexes[normalIndexes.size() - i - 1];
00215     }
00216     addFace(newVerts, newNorms);
00217 }
00218 
00219 void Mesh::addFaceAndReverse(std::vector<int>& vertIndexes)
00220 {
00221     addFace(vertIndexes);
00222     std::vector<int> newVerts;
00223     newVerts.resize(vertIndexes.size());
00224     for (int i = 0; i < vertIndexes.size(); i++)
00225     {
00226         newVerts[i] = vertIndexes[vertIndexes.size() - i - 1];
00227     }
00228     addFace(newVerts);
00229 }
00230 
00235 void Mesh::calculateNormals() {
00236     //First, clear normal data
00237     normals.resize(vertices.size());
00238     for (int i = 0; i < normals.size(); i++) {
00239         normals[i] = Point3(0,0,0);
00240     }
00241 
00242     //This will add every face's normal to all of the vertices of that face
00243     //then reassign each normal index to the corresponding vertex index
00244     for (int i = 0; i < faces.size(); i++) {
00245         faces[i].addOwnNormals();
00246     }
00247 
00248     //This will normalize all normals, so that they are unit
00249     for (int i = 0; i < normals.size(); i++) {
00250         normals[i] = normals[i].getUnit();
00251     }
00252 }
00253 
00254 bool Mesh::drawMesh() {
00255     for (int i = 0; i < faces.size(); i++) {
00256         if (!faces[i].drawFace()) {
00257             return false;
00258         }
00259     }
00260     return true;
00261 }
